ygData.subject: Re: South Karana
ygData.msgSnippet: If you were healer for a well-balanced group that works well together, I think so. The problem in Runnyeye is the shere numbers of mobs at times and in places.
ygData.messageBody:
If you were healer for a well-balanced group that works well
together, I think so. The problem in Runnyeye is the shere numbers of
mobs at times and in places. Many lower level caster mobs, so you
cound get hit with spells often disrupting your own casting. The
deeper in and farther down you go, the harder it gets, as seems to be
the case for most dungeons.

As a plus, I think an experience bonus is in place in Runnyeye.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
>
> Do you think a lvl 32 cleric would do ok in Runnyeye?
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Hehe, I don't know the answer to your question about the ore, but
I had to
> > respond:
> >
> > I am so happy to find out that I am not the only Druid that hates
> dungeons.
> > Give me the wide open spaces of the Karanas, the Overthere, the
> Dreadlands,
> > or even Rathe Mts. any day. Seems like every time I venture into,
say,
> > Runnyeye, Sol A, Sol B, or Lower Guk, I get killed. In fact I
just got
> > de-leveled back into hell 40 this past weekend because of some
nasty
> > Pickclaw Casters in the bottom level of Runnyeye. They didn't
like the
> fact
> > that I was healing a level 24 warrior that wanted some Blackened
Alloy,
> and
> > I was too proud to desert him to his death to save my own skin.
> >
> > Froondor
> >
> > Wood Elf Druid of 40 seasons, Tarew Marr server.
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: <MLockridge01@c...>
> > To: <EverQuest@y...>
> > Sent: Sunday, November 11, 2001 10:36 AM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] South Karana
> >
> >
> > > I took the advice of others here and having finished my goals
in EK I
> > > moved to SK. I have found the gnolls camped heavily, but while
there
> > > have found Aviak Rooks wandering with sufficient frequency to be
> > > profitable. I solo them, getting about 1.5pp average in cash and
> > > loot. Not too bad, and I can pick off something else when they
are
> > > too thin.
> > >
> > > Anyone know if the hq ore dropped in Runnyeye is no drop? My
druid
> > > does not do that well in dungeons, so hunting up the stuff
myself is
> > > not a happy prospect.
> > >
> > > Barto Proudfoot, Halfling Druid
